GridGUI.desc: A class used as a namespace to protect the lib and a user's script from unintended name hijacking.

GridGUIClass.desc: A class representing a gui with a grid.

grid.desc: The grid that controls are put into.

showGrid.desc: Used to remember what parameter the `GridGUI.GridGUIClass` instance was created with and to decide whether or not to move the debug grid when drawn.

gridlines.desc: The container for the horisontal and vertical grid line controls shown when `GridGUIClass.showGrid` is true.

margins.desc: The additional space that is added around controls that are added to the grid.

__DrawGrid.desc: Moves the debug grid line controls to the appropriate locations.

args.name: area
args.desc: the area where in the debug grid lines are moved.

args.name: showGrid
args.desc: Whether or not to show a grid for the control that where placed on the gui before it was shown the first time.

args.name: title
args.desc: The title that the new gui window will have

args.name: options
args.desc: The ahk gui options that the window will be created with

args.name: showGrid
args.desc: Whether or not to show a grid for the control that where placed on the gui before it was shown the first time.

args.name: justify
args.desc: The position of the controls with in the grid, can be any combination of `C` (Center), `N` (North), `S` (South), `W` (West) and `E` (East).

__TranslateGridPos.desc: Transforms the cordinate syntax used when adding controls to a grid area

args.name: x
args.desc: The Columns that the cell spans over. When more than one column is wanted separate the start and end columns with a hyphen, e.g. "2-5".

args.name: y
args.desc: The Rows that the cell spans over. When more than one row is wanted separate the start and end rows with a hyphen, e.g. "2-5".

returns.desc: Returns the translated position as a point with a width and a height.

_GuiMoved.desc: A callback called when the gui was moved that calls the `GridGUI.GUI._GuiMoved` and shows a debug tooltip with the position if `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.showGrid` is true.

args.name: pos
args.desc: The new position, only containing coordinate of the top right corner.

_GuiSize.desc: A callback called when the gui was resized, that calls the `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.Draw` method, `GridGUI.GUI._GuiSize` and draws the debug grid if `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.showGrid` is true.

args.name: pos
args.desc: The new area, only containing width and height of the gui, that is x and y is both zero.

Add.desc: Adds a new cell with any of the standard controls to the grid and gui.

args.name: x
args.desc: The Columns that the cell spans over. When more than one column is wanted separate the start and end columns with a hyphen, e.g. "2-5".

args.name: y
args.desc: The Rows that the cell spans over. When more than one row is wanted separate the start and end rows with a hyphen, e.g. "2-5".

args.name: type
args.desc: The type of the control. Can be `Text, Edit, UpDown, Picture, Button, Checkbox, DropDownList, ComboBox, ListBox, Link, Hotkey, DateTime, MonthCal, Slider, Progress, GroupBox and ActiveX`. For `Radio, ListView, TreeView, Tab3 and StatusBar` see [AdditionalControls](AdditionalControls)

args.name: options
args.desc: The options that the GuiControl will be created with. Does not accept vVars. Can be an object with keys the same names as the optional arguments that this method takes.

args.name: text
args.desc: The text that the control will be created with.

args.name: exW
args.desc: How much of the excess width the cell should take up relative to the other width expanding cells. Can be an object with keys the same names as the optional arguments that this method takes.

args.name: exH
args.desc: How much of the excess height the cell should take up relative to the other height expanding cells.

args.name: fillW
args.desc: Whether or not the control should fill the width of the cell.

args.name: fillH
args.desc: Whether or not the control should fill the height of the cell.

args.name: justify
args.desc: The position of the control with in the cell, can be any combination of `C` (Center), `N` (North), `S` (South), `W` (West) and `E` (East).

AddControl.desc: Adds a new cell to the grid and sets the cells control to the supplied control class instance.

args.name: x
args.desc: The Columns that the cell spans over. When more than one column is wanted separate the start and end columns with a hyphen, e.g. "2-5".

args.name: y
args.desc: The Rows that the cell spans over. When more than one row is wanted separate the start and end rows with a hyphen, e.g. "2-5".

args.name: ctrl
args.desc: The control that will be put in the cell.

args.name: exW
args.desc: How much of the excess width the cell should take up relative to the other width expanding cells. Can be an object with keys the same names as the optional arguments that this method takes.

args.name: exH
args.desc: How much of the excess height the cell should take up relative to the other height expanding cells.

args.name: fillW
args.desc: Whether or not the control should fill the width of the cell.

args.name: fillH
args.desc: Whether or not the control should fill the height of the cell.

args.name: justify
args.desc: The position of the control with in the cell, can be any combination of `C` (Center), `N` (North), `S` (South), `W` (West) and `E` (East).

returns.desc: Returns the control that the method was called with.

AutoSize.desc: Calculates the minimum size required to show all the controls in the grid and sets the `GridGUI.GUI.pos` to the calculated width and height, as well as updates the controls in the grid to their positions. Can be used to reduce the number of controls that a noticeable misplaced when the gui is drawn the first time if called before calling `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.Show`.

Draw.desc: Calculates the new positions of the controls in the grid based on the settings of their `GridGUI.Cell` and moved them to their new positions.

args.name: pos
args.desc: The area the controls will be put into and sized to fit if `GridGUI.Cell.exW`, `GridGUI.Cell.exH`, `GridGUI.Cell.fillW` or `GridGUI.Cell.fillH` of the cell that the control occupies are set.

GetCellGroup.desc: Retrieve a `GridGUI.Cell` by its associated control.

args.name: Ctrl
args.desc: The control used to match the right `GridGUI.Cell`

GetCellGroupsAt.desc: Retrieve the array of `GridGUI.Cell`s that are in a grid position.

args.name: GridPos
args.desc: The grid position where the `GridGUI.Cell`s are retrieved from.

Margin.desc: Sets the `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.margins` to the supplied x and y margins and updates all `GridGUI.Cell`s in `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.grid` to use the new border sizes.

args.name: x
args.desc: The new horisontal margin to use, that is the spacing to the right and left of cells. If set to "" the current value will be left unchanged.

args.name: y
args.desc: The new vertical margin to use, that is the spacing above and below cells. If set to "" the current value will be left unchanged.

ReDraw.desc: Resets cached calculations and calls `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.Draw` with the current positions and size.

RemoveCell.desc: Removes a `GridGUI.Cell` and the associated control from the grid and gui.

args.name: Cell
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` that will be removed.

RemoveCellByCtrl.desc: Removes a `GridGUI.Cell` with a specific control from the grid.

args.name: Ctrl
args.desc: The control that is used to search for the `GridGUI.Cell`

RemoveCellByPos.desc: Removes a `GridGUI.Cell` in the array of `GridGUI.Cell`s at a specific position in the grid, by the array index.

args.name: GridPos
args.desc: The grid position where the `GridGUI.Cell`s are retrieved from.

args.name: index
args.desc: The index to be removed.

Show.desc: Shows that gui by calling `GridGUI.GUI.Show` with the given options.

args.name: options
args.desc: The options that is used when calling `Gui, Show`.

SubGrid.desc: A class that allows a `GridGUI.GridGUIClass` to be added to the `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.grid` the same way that controls are added, by not creating a new gui and by providing the required methods.

hwnd.desc: The hwnd of the gui that the `GridGUI.SubGrid` adds controls to when calling `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.Add` and `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.AddControl`. Needed since a subgrid does not make its own gui.

pos.desc: The position of the subgrid. Needed since a subgrid does not make its own gui and thus do not have the gui event callbacks.

DPIScale.desc: Whether or not to change the size of controls based on DPI. Needed since a subgrid does not make its own gui to handle the gui options.

minWidth.desc: Whether or not to restrict the min width of the subgrid to `GridGUI.SubGrid.minWidthVal`. Needed in providing the interface required to be managed by a `GridGUI.Cell` instance.

minHeight.desc: Whether or not to restrict the min height of the subgrid to `GridGUI.SubGrid.minHeightVal`. Needed in providing the interface required to be managed by a `GridGUI.Cell` instance.

minWidthVal.desc: The min width of the `GridGUI.SubGrid`. Needed in providing the interface required to be managed by a `GridGUI.Cell` instance.

minHeightVal.desc: The min height of the `GridGUI.SubGrid`. Needed in providing the interface required to be managed by a `GridGUI.Cell` instance.

__Init.desc: Sets the min size of the subgrid and initialises the members that are required when managed by a `GridGUI.Cell` instance.

args.name: area
args.desc: The minimum area that the subgrid will have.

args.name: guiHwnd
args.desc: The hwnd of the gui that the `GridGUI.SubGrid` adds controls to when calling `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.Add` and `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.AddControl`. Needed since a subgrid does not make its own gui.

args.name: area
args.desc: The minimum area that the subgrid will have.

args.name: DPIScale
args.desc: Whether or not to change the size of controls based on DPI. Needed since a subgrid does not make its own gui to handle the gui options.

args.name: showGrid
args.desc: Whether or not to show a debug grid for the `GridGUI.Cell`s that where placed in the GridGUI.SubGrid.grid` before `GridGUI.SubGrid.Draw` was called the first time.

args.name: justify
args.desc: The position of the controls with in the grid, can be any combination of `C` (Center), `N` (North), `S` (South), `W` (West) and `E` (East).

GetPos.desc: Retrieves the position of the subgrid. Needed in providing the interface required to be managed by a `GridGUI.Cell` instance.

returns.desc: The last position that `GridGUI.SubGrid.Draw` was called with.

MinSize.desc: Sets the minimum size of the subgrid. The min size is used by a `GridGUI.Cell` to determin the cells size.

args.name: w
args.desc: The minimal width of the subgrid, if left empty the current min width won't be changed unless both parameters are left empty in which case the min width will be set to the current width of the subgrid.

args.name: h
args.desc: The minimal height of the subgrid, if left empty the current min height won't be changed unless both parameters are left empty in which case the min height will be set to the current height of the subgrid.

Draw.desc: Stores the area in `GridGUI.SubGrid.pos` and calculates the new positions of the controls in the subgrid based on the settings of their `GridGUI.Cell` and moved them to their new positions.

args.name: area
args.desc: The area that the controls in the grid will be sized to fit into if possible.

Background.desc: Used in the handling of controls that have been registered as background

ExitApp.desc: Allows quick access to set up a callback that terminates the script

__ExitApp.desc: A convenience function wrapper for the command.

__New.desc: A convenience constructor that maps to the GridGUIClass.

args.name: title
args.desc: The title that the new gui window will have

args.name: options
args.desc: The ahk gui options that the window will be created with.

args.name: showGrid
args.desc: Whether or not to show a debug grid for the `GridGUI.Cell`s that where placed in the `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.grid` before `GridGUI.GridGUIClass.Draw` was called the first time.

args.name: justify
args.desc: The position of the controls with in the grid, can be any combination of `C` (Center), `N` (North), `S` (South), `W` (West) and `E` (East).

Area.desc: A convenience function for making a Position that is used as an area.

args.name: w
args.desc: The width of the area.

args.name: h
args.desc: The height of the area.

args.name: x
args.desc: The x coordinate of the top left corner of the area.

args.name: y
args.desc: The y coordinate of the top left corner of the area.

Pos.desc: A convenience function for making a Position, saves writting "new".

args.name: x
args.desc: The x coordinate of the position.

args.name: y
args.desc: The y coordinate of the position.

args.name: w
args.desc: The width of the area spanning from the top left corner at (x, y) to the bottom right corner.

args.name: h
args.desc: The height of the area spanning from the top left corner at (x, y) to the bottom right corner.
